answers.answer: Hi,This could be sweat dermatitis, sun rash or allergic reactions. Do the lesions itch? What kind of pain is there?Has diabetes been ruled out?Nothing can be said with surety without having a look at the lesions.You could try some antihistamine medications and see if it helps with your symptoms. Use a medicated sunscreen whenever you go out and avoid sun exposure as much as possible.It would be best to consult your doctor about your symptoms if they do not resolve and get a proper clinical examination.Let us know about what your doctor advises. Post us if you have any other doubts or queries.Regards.

question: Last summer my right fore arm was burned in the sun even though I had sun block on. By taking  Gabapentin 300 mg for over 2 mos mos it cleared up. It has returned, my right fore arm only is very sensitive n painful when it flares up. My latest bout is over 2 mos. Yesterday really set off the pain by wearing a long sleeve shirt: shirt was 40% polyester n 60% cotton. Problem; if look at my arm there is "NO" surface indicators to the severe sensitivity n pain.
title: Highly Sensitive Fore Arm w no Surface Indication
